newsitem.title: USA: Versant shares fall 28 percent on loss forecast.
newsitem.headline: Versant shares fall 28 percent on loss forecast.

text.p: Versant Object Technology Corp. shares fell 28 percent Wednesday after the database software company said it expected to report a first-quarter loss on weaker-than-expected sales.
Shares of Versant, based in Menlo Park, Calif., fell $2.375 to $6.25.

Versant said it will report a loss of between 11 cents to 15 cents a share for the quarter ended March 31 on revenue of $3.5 million. While revenue will be about 9 percent higher than in the same quarter a year ago, it will be less than the company expected, Versant said.
Wall Street expected Versant to earn 2 cents a share, according to First Call. In the fourth quarter of last year, Versant earned $696,000, or 7 cents a share, on revenues of $5.6 million.

"We believe that the revenue shortfall results principally from the timing and complexity of large-project opportunities, rather than losses of business to competition," said David Banks, Versant president.
Versant released the forecast after the market closed. During trading hours, its shares had traded as low as $5.125.
